snippet: The Pentagon explicitly accused China of attacking government systems and defense contractors, possibly to map “military capabilities that could be exploited during a crisis.”
abstract: Obama administration explicitly accuses China’s military of mounting attacks on American government computer systems and defense contractors; while some estimates have more than 90 percent of cyberespionage in United States originating in China, accusations relayed in Pentagon’s annual report to Congress on Chinese military capabilities are remarkable in their directness.
lead_paragraph: The Pentagon explicitly accused China of attacking government systems and defense contractors, possibly to map “military capabilities that could be exploited during a crisis.”

headline.seo: U.S. Accuses China’s Military in Cyberattacks
headline.main: U.S. Blames China’s Military Directly for Cyberattacks
headline.print_headline: China’s Military Is Accused by U.S. In Cyberattacks

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
